repo.description: The most widely used Python to C compiler
repo.name: cython

body: The upcoming change to scipy to move from setuptools to meson as a build tool has a side effect of turning on `-Werror -Wall`. When trying out the build I discovered that two of the conditional stanzas need a bit of tweaking to avoid warnings when used with PyPy.

comment_data.body:
As a general rule we drop most comments from the utility code so we don't leave a lot in the generated code. There has to be a fairly good reason to want users to see it to leave a comment in the generated C (e.g. https://github.com/cython/cython/pull/3582, which is deliberately generating a compiler warning if the users do something wrong, but also leaves a comment for them to try to explain what to do).

With that in mind, it might be better as a Python comment, rather than a C comment)
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -5502,6 +5504,7 @@ def generate_type_ready_code(entry, code, bases_tuple_cname=None, check_heap_typ
                         code.putln(preprocessor_guard)
                     code.putln('#if CYTHON_COMPILING_IN_CPYTHON')
                     code.putln("{")
+                    code.putln('/* The docstring is set after PyType_Ready, which may not work on non-cpython */')

@@ -5502,6 +5504,7 @@ def generate_type_ready_code(entry, code, bases_tuple_cname=None, check_heap_typ
                         code.putln(preprocessor_guard)
                     code.putln('#if CYTHON_COMPILING_IN_CPYTHON')
                     code.putln("{")
+                    code.putln('/* The docstring is set after PyType_Ready, which may not work on non-cpython */')

comment_data.body: This silences a warning about unused `no_error` if not `CYTHON_USE_PYLONG_INTERNALS` is not defined
I implemented the needed pieces to properly use `PyWrapperDescrObject.d_base.doc` for the docstring in PyPy 7.3.9.

The usual pattern is to set the define to 0 or 1 and test if it's defined (or explicitly undefine it), so that users can override it by setting it externally via CFLAGS, and different Python implementations can define it to their needs.

Also, the name suggests to me that this removes all usages of the `tp_doc` slot, which it doesn't.
`CYTHON_UPDATE_DESCRIPTOR_DOC` ?
updating to use the positive `CYTHON_UPDATE_DESCRIPTOR_DOC` rather than the negative `CYTHON_AVOID_SLOT_DOC`

Could you please guard these with `#ifndef`s? You never know if users may have reasons to disable the flag in the future. However unlikely that is, the flag is there, so why not make it easy to configure it.

comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -3694,7 +3694,7 @@ def generate_function_header(self, code, with_pymethdef, proto_only=0):
                     docstr.as_c_string_literal()))
 
             if entry.is_special:
-                code.putln('#if CYTHON_COMPILING_IN_CPYTHON')
+                code.putln('#ifdef CYTHON_UPDATE_DESCRIPTOR_DOC')

@@ -5500,7 +5500,7 @@ def generate_type_ready_code(entry, code, bases_tuple_cname=None, check_heap_typ
                     preprocessor_guard = slot.preprocessor_guard_code() if slot else None
                     if preprocessor_guard:
                         code.putln(preprocessor_guard)
-                    code.putln('#if CYTHON_COMPILING_IN_CPYTHON')
+                    code.putln('#ifdef CYTHON_UPDATE_DESCRIPTOR_DOC')

@@ -3694,7 +3694,7 @@ def generate_function_header(self, code, with_pymethdef, proto_only=0):
                     docstr.as_c_string_literal()))
 
             if entry.is_special:
-                code.putln('#if CYTHON_COMPILING_IN_CPYTHON')
+                code.putln('#ifdef CYTHON_UPDATE_DESCRIPTOR_DOC')

comment_data.body:
The code was previously dependent on `CYTHON_COMPILING_IN_CPYTHON`, so let's not annoy other Python implementations with it.
```suggestion
    #define CYTHON_UPDATE_DESCRIPTOR_DOC 0
```

commit.message: build scipy on pypy cleanly with -Wall -Werror
use wrapperbase for descr doc on PyPy>=7.3.9
Keep GraalPython and limited API as they are.

milestone.description:
Goals:
– New version scheme: 3.x instead of 0.x.
– Change default `language_level` from `2` to `3`.
– Change default for `binding` directive from `False` to `True`.
– Fix some Python compatibility issues (if possible, allowing for breaking changes).

title: Allow setting descriptor docstring on PyPy>v7.3.9
